author: andschwa

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: PSReadLine catches it if there's something to cancel, but otherwise does not catch it and so PowerShell receives SIGINT.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Ah, so far what I've determined through actual testing is that PSReadLine catches Ctrl-C while in the `ReadLine` loop. But if a command is running, it is not caught and therefore seen as SIGINT.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Just need to port the `BreakHandler` in `ConsoleHost`, which wasn't done in the merger. Updating to use `Console.CancelKeyPress`.

title: Ctrl-C is caught by PSReadLine but not when commands are executing
